Description: Fragment of neck and shoulder, with handle scar, of Attic black-figured pottery lekythos. On the shoulder, panther (its head and neck preserved) between youths (their upper bodies remain); added red on the neck of the panther and the himation of the left youth.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 81 no. 270 pl. 61)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1928)
